channel.title: Orama Interactive

item.title: Pixelorama v0.11.3 is out!
item.description: Artwork by Uch, one of the artists for v0.11’s splash screen artworks. Version 0.11.3, another small maintenance update, is here!

item.title: Pixelorama v0.11.2 is out!
item.description: Artwork by Roroto Sic, one of the artists for v0.11’s splash screen artworks. So I know how I mentioned that work is now focused on version 1.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.11.1 is out!
item.description: Artwork by Wishdream, one of the artists for v0.11’s splash screen artworks. The 0.x versions haven’t said their last word yet.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.11 is out!
item.description: Artwork by Exuvita, one of the artists for v0.11’s splash screen artworks. After almost nine months, a new version of Pixelorama, version 0.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.10.3 is out!
item.description: Artwork by Kalpar, one of the artists for v0.10’s splash screen artworks. Pixelorama v0.10.3 is out today!

item.title: Pixelorama v0.10.2 is out & Voxelorama is open-sourced!
item.description: Artwork by Uch, one of the artists for v0.10’s splash screen artworks. Today is a special day for Pixelorama.

item.title: Announcing Voxelorama
item.description: Art by Erevoid. In our previous blog post about Pixelorama v0.10, we teased about an exciting announcement for our 10 years of Orama Interactive anniversary (17 of April 2012- 17 of April 2022).

item.title: Pixelorama v0.10.1 is out!
item.description: Artwork by Wishdream, one of the artists for v0.10’s splash screen artworks. We have amazing news for you!

item.title: Pixelorama v0.10 is out!
item.description: Artwork by Roroto Sic, one of the artists for v0.10’s splash screen artworks. Hello everyone! We hope you all are doing well.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.9 is out!
item.description: Hello everyone, it’s been a while. Although we have been releasing smaller updates during this time (v0.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.8 is out!
item.description: Pixelorama has been growing more and more. After v0.7 was released, we hit over 20k downloads on itch.

item.title: Pixelorama is coming to the Web!
item.description: Your dearly beloved piece of software, Pixelorama, is coming to the Web! …Okay…? What does that mean?

item.title: Pixelorama v0.7 is out!
item.description: Art by Wishdream - winner of the first Pixelorama splash screen art contest! This took a while.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.6 is out!
item.description: Artwork by Erevos I have no words. The support we received for Pixelorama v0.5 was too much to handle!

item.title: Pixelorama v0.5 is out!
item.description: Major UI overhaul - at last! Artwork by Erevos I have to say, this update was finished earlier than I expected.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.4 is out!
item.description: These last days were surprisingly productive. The update would have rolled out sooner if I didn’t have such a hard time with Undo/Redo.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.3 is out!
item.description: I was having some bad days lately, but I managed to work on Pixelorama… when I could.

item.title: Pixelorama v0.2 is out!
item.description: I swear I wasn’t procrastinating! I was just busy with studying and working on our game!

item.title: I made my own Sprite Editor in Godot
item.description: Like I’m not busy enough already… Making a game (more details coming soon!), working hard to open a game development studio, Orama Interactive, and become a full time indie developer, studying for uni… you name it!

item.title: Making a Discord Bot with Godot (Part Three)
item.description: This is a followup tutorial in the “Making a Discord Bot with Godot series“. Make sure to read Part One and Part Two first!

item.title: Making a Discord Bot with Godot (Part Two)
item.description: This is a continuation from Part One, which you can find here. Back for more I see?

item.title: Making a Discord Bot with Godot (Part One)
item.description: This tutorial uses Godot Engine 3.1 (but it should be working with newer versions too), as well as its GDScript language.

item.title: Emmanouil Papadeas
item.description: I am a co-founder and lead developer of Orama Interactive, an indie game (and software, apparently) development team.
